title: 103_hr4716
content: The Act titled "Antidumping Compensation Act of 1994" introduces a new section for compensation awards under the Tariff Act of 1930. The Act titled "Antidumping Compensation Act of 1994" introduces definitions for key terms related to antidumping duty findings and orders, countervailing duty orders, and the roles of the Commissioner and Secretary. The Act "Antidumping Compensation Act of 1994" defines key terms related to antidumping duty findings and orders, countervailing duty orders, and the roles of the Commissioner and Secretary. The Commissioner will establish procedures for distributing compensation annually within 30 days of the release of the Annual Report on the Status of the Antidumping/Countervailing Duty Program. Eligible parties include petitioners and supporters of petitions for antidumping duty findings or orders, or countervailing duty orders. The Act defines key terms related to antidumping duty findings and orders, countervailing duty orders, and the roles of the Commissioner and Secretary. The Commissioner will distribute compensation annually within 30 days of the release of the Annual Report on the Status of the Antidumping/Countervailing Duty Program. Eligible parties include petitioners and supporters of petitions for antidumping duty findings or orders, or countervailing duty orders. The Commissioner shall maintain the confidentiality of data submitted by the Commission. The Commission shall forward required information to the Commissioner within 60 days of the effective date for antidumping duty findings or orders, and within 60 days of issuance for new orders. For countervailing duty orders without injury determination, the timeline is extended to 180 days. The Commissioner will publish a notice of intent to distribute compensation in the Federal Register. The Commissioner will publish a notice in the Federal Register at least 30 days before distributing compensation to eligible recipients. Recipients must certify their desire to receive compensation and continue manufacturing the relevant product. All funds from assessments will be distributed proportionately to recipients from a special compensation account. Prior to distributing compensation from special accounts, the Commissioner will deduct a historically budgeted amount from total duties assessed for antidumping and countervailing duty orders. Each account will be reduced proportionately before distribution based on the deducted amount. Within 14 days of the effective date, the Commissioner establishes special compensation accounts in the Treasury for antidumping and countervailing duty orders. All collected duties, including interest, are deposited into these accounts before distribution. The Commissioner establishes special compensation accounts in the Treasury for antidumping and countervailing duty orders. The amounts in these accounts are available for compensation awards, with regulations specifying the time and manner of payments. Each account remains active until the related order terminates and all duties are settled. The Commissioner establishes special compensation accounts in the Treasury for antidumping and countervailing duty orders. The funds in the account are distributed to eligible persons for compensation awards. Any remaining amounts after 90 days are deposited in the general Treasury.
